creator: ianh@hubspan.com
text:
-Was attempting to capture the SSL_CLIENT_CERT env var exported by mod_ssl
 and set its value in a  HTTP header  called 'SSL_CLIENT_CERT'

looks like the cert was exported in PEM format correctly 
eg.
------ BEGIN CERTIFICATE ------
messy b64 encoded stuff here
------ END CERTIFICATE ------

the header value was being truncate at the first \r\n 

there was a thread on yahoo indicating that someone else has found 
it on Wed Feb 12, 2003 and was proposing a fix also

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/new-httpd/message/42575

Please advise.

PS: we aren't able to use modJK2 for various reason and thus
need to rely on mod_proxy and mod_header to do the job.

creator: ianh@hubspan.com
text:
this proposed fix has been working well for us since 2.0.47..since then, we've 
also upgraded to 2.0.51 and subsequently 2.0.52.. but always had to perform 
this patch and recompile.

what's the process of getting this into the code base for the next release?

thanks.

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
It is proposed for backport to 2.0.x but reviewers found some issues which I
haven't yet had time to address.
This appears to be fixed in 2.2 without issues.  Close as fixed, or backport to 2.0?
